examples.romaji_meaning: Gaimushō (Ministry of Foreign Affairs) no tantōsha (person in charge)
examples.english: Official from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

examples.romaji_meaning: Gaimushō (Ministry of Foreign Affairs) ga happyō (announcement)
Gaimusho (Ministry of Foreign Affairs) de hatarakimasu (work)
examples.english: I work at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

examples.sentence: 外務省の発表によると…
examples.romaji: Gaimusho no happyou ni yoru to...
examples.romaji_meaning: Gaimusho (Ministry of Foreign Affairs) no happyou (announcement) ni yoru to (according to)...
examples.english: According to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs' announcement...

examples.romaji_meaning: Hanron (Rebuttal) no yochi (room) ga nai (there isn't)
examples.english: There is no room for rebuttal.
It is a nuclear power plant.

examples.romaji_meaning: Fuyō (Unnecessary) na mono (things) o suteru (throw away)

examples.romaji_meaning: Fuyou (Unnecessary) na mono (things) wa sutemasu (throw away)

examples.sentence: 子供に絵本を読み聞かせる
examples.romaji_meaning: Kodomo (Child) ni ehon (picture book) o yomikikaseru (read aloud)
examples.english: To read a picture book aloud to a child.

examples.sentence: 子供に絵本を読みます
examples.romaji_meaning: Kodomo (Child) ni ehon (picture book) o yomimasu (read)
examples.english: I read a picture book to the child.

examples.romaji_meaning: Zennen (Previous year) hi de (compared to) zōka (increase)
examples.english: Increase compared to the previous year.
Comparison with the same month of the previous year.

examples.sentence: 前年より増加しました
examples.english: It increased compared to the previous year.

examples.romaji_meaning: Kyūjin (Job opening) jōhō (information) o sagasu (search for)
examples.english: To search for job opening information.
I put out a job opening.
To gradually get used to it.

examples.sentence: 次第に暖かくなります
小型で使いやすいです
examples.romaji_meaning: Kogata (Small) de tsukai yasui (easy to use) desu (is)
examples.english: It is small and easy to use.

examples.sentence: 商品を急いで出荷します
死者の数が増えました
examples.english: The number of deceased has increased.
I met on the first day.
To be active from early morning.
I wake up early in the morning.

examples.sentence: 早朝の空気は澄んでいます
examples.romaji: Sōchō no kuuki wa sunde imasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Sōchō (Early morning) no kuuki (air) wa sunde (clear) desu (is)
examples.english: The air in the early morning is clear.

examples.sentence: たばこ屋で煙草を買う

examples.english: I go to the tobacco shop.

examples.sentence: たばこ屋は閉まっています
examples.romaji_meaning: Tabako ya (Tobacco shop) wa shimatte imasu (is closed)

examples.english: There is a lack of manpower.
I spend time in a relaxed way.

examples.romaji_meaning: Nyūshi (Entrance exam) no junbi (preparation) o shimasu (do)
examples.english: I prepare for the entrance exam.

examples.romaji_meaning: Kaijou (Sea surface) o hikouki (airplane) ga tobimasu (flies)

examples.sentence: 並みの努力ではだめです
examples.romaji: Nami no doryoku de wa dame desu

examples.english: I am faithful to my promise.

examples.romaji_meaning: Rikujou kyōgi (Track and field) o shimasu (do)

examples.english: I am a member of the family.

examples.romaji_meaning: Tan'nin (Homeroom teacher) o utsū (take charge of)
examples.english: To be in charge of a homeroom.
